channel.title: Landscape editor question
channel.description: how do you make the tiles "walkable" after u edit the landscape.rscd file? and how do u add objects to the tiles like flowers, trees ect..? anyway you could make a youtube video or something?

item.title: Landscape editor question
item.dc:creator: @xrune xrune
item.description:
@xrune wrote:

works thanks codeforfame i jus have to figure out how to put the objects on the landscape now…

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor question
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:4, topic:487018”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=605253.msg4225740#msg4225740 date=1360991129]
You need to have the same landscape on the server-side as the client side.

Also, flower, trees, etc. are objects, which have nothing to do with the landscape.
[/quote]

What if the tile was once unwalkable( LAva or water) and then you put a ground (walkable) tile over it, would you be able to walk over it?[/quote]Yes… You still need to make sure the client and server are using the same landscape file.

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor question
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:4, topic:487018”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=605253.msg4225740#msg4225740 date=1360991129]
You need to have the same landscape on the server-side as the client side.

Also, flower, trees, etc. are objects, which have nothing to do with the landscape.
[/quote]

What if the tile was once unwalkable( LAva or water) and then you put a ground (walkable) tile over it, would you be able to walk over it?[/quote]
If I remember correctly you’d first delete the lava/water tile then add say a grass tile which is walkable.

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor question
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:2, topic:487018”]You need to have the same landscape on the server-side as the client side.

Also, flower, trees, etc. are objects, which have nothing to do with the landscape.[/quote]

What if the tile was once unwalkable( LAva or water) and then you put a ground (walkable) tile over it, would you be able to walk over it?

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor question
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

No one is going to make a YouTube video exclusively for you. What landscape editor are you using? Did you replace the landscape in both the client and server? Objects aren’t stored in the landscape (normally). They’re stored in an XML file server side.

Edit CFF beat me to first reply, damn iPad

Read full topic
